content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata><idinfo><citation><citeinfo><origin>Joint Airborne Lidar Bathymetry Technical Center of eXpertise (JALBTCX)</origin><pubdate>unknown</pubdate><title>2016 USACE National Coastal Mapping Program (NCMP) Gulf Coast Lidar and Imagery Acquisition - Texas, Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama and Florida</title><geoform>vector digital data</geoform><pubinfo><pubplace>Kiln, MS</pubplace><publish>JALBTCX</publish></pubinfo><onlink>http://maps.usace.army.mil:8399/arcgis/rest/services/JALBTCX/JALBTCX_Planning/MapServer</onlink><CI_OnlineResource><linkage>http://maps.usace.army.mil:8399/arcgis/rest/services/JALBTCX/JALBTCX_Planning/MapServer</linkage><name>JALBTCX Survey Planning Web Service</name><description>This service provides users with polygons to depict planned lidar and imagery acquisition areas for upcoming USACE National Coastal Mapping Program (NCMP) surveys that will be executed by the Joint Airborne Lidar Bathymetry Technical Center of Expertise (JALBTCX).  View the service via a link to ArcGIS.com Map.  Once the map opens in your web browser, select \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdDetails\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd.  Pan and zoom the map to your area of interest, and click the second radio button to \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdShow Contents of Map\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd.   Click \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdJALBTCX_Planning\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd and then check the box next to your year of interest.  (You may need to uncheck boxes next to additional layers to visualize the planning polygons).</description><function>download</function></CI_OnlineResource><lworkcit><citeinfo><origin>DOD/USARMY/USACE/SAM/MOBILE</origin><origin>US Army Corps of Engineers</origin><origin>JALBTCX (Joint Airborne Lidar Bathymetry Technical Center of eXpertise)</origin><pubdate>Unknown</pubdate><title>2016 USACE National Coastal Mapping Program (NCMP) Planned Lidar and Imagery Acquisition</title><othercit>Project level</othercit><CI_OnlineResource><linkage>http://www.jalbtcx.org/silverlight.aspx?Viewer=JALBTCX&Theme=Planned</linkage><name>JALBTCX viewer (requires Microsoft Silverlight)</name><description>Web viewer for browsing planned lidar and imagery coverage polygons</description><function>download</function></CI_OnlineResource><CI_OnlineResource><linkage>http://www.jalbtcx.org/Mapping.aspx</linkage><name>NCMP</name><description>USACE  National Coastal Mapping Program (NCMP) website</description><function>information</function></CI_OnlineResource><CI_OnlineResource><linkage>http://www.jalbtcx.org/</linkage><name>JALBTCX</name><description>Joint Airborne Lidar Bathymetry Technical Center of Expertise (JALBTCX) website</description><function>information</function></CI_OnlineResource></citeinfo></lworkcit></citeinfo></citation><descript><abstract>The Joint Airborne Lidar Bathymetry Technical Center of Expertise (JALBTCX) plans to perform a coastal survey along the Gulf Coast in 2016 with funding provided by the US Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) National Coastal Mapping Program (NCMP). The data types to be collected include bathymetric and topographic lidar point data, down-looking aerial imagery and hyperspectral imagery. The collection effort will follow the coastline and extend 500m inland and 1000m offshore or to bathymetric lidar extinction, whichever comes first. Topographic lidar data will have a nominal sub-meter post-spacing. Where water conditions permit, the bathymetric lidar data will have nominal 2m x 2m postings. Vertical accuracy of the topographic lidar data will meet or exceed RMSEZ=15 cm. Bathymetric lidar data will have a vertical accuracy of 30 cm, 2-sigma. The aerial imagery will have a pixel size approximately 20cm and the hyperspectral imagery will be provided in 1m pixels containing 36 spectral bands between 375 - 1050 nm with 19 nm bandwidth. The data will be collected on the NAD83 ellipsoid using NGS published monuments as control. Final data will be tied horizontally to NAD83 (NSRS 2007) in geographic coordinates. Vertical measurements will be converted from NAD83 ellipsoid heights in meters to NAVD88 orthometric heights using the current Geoid model at the time of acquisition. Data products from this survey effort will include topographic and bathymetric lidar point clouds in LAS format, an NAVD88 0m shoreline contour, and a series of raster data products including topo/bathy digital elevation models (DEMs), true-color aerial image mosaics, hyperspectral image mosaics, laser reflectance images and basic landcover classification images. Images of water column properties (i.e. chlorophyll and CDOM concentrations) will also be generated. Within 6 months of completing the data acquisition, these final data products will be available for public use in the absence of any unforeseen data processing delays.</abstract><purpose>The JALBTCX plans to survey the Gulf Coast which includes the states of Texas, Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama and Florida in support of the USACE NCMP.</purpose><supplinf>These planning data are considered provisional and are subject to change as the survey date approaches. Survey planning meetings will be held with the USACE Galveston, New Orleans, Mobile and Jacksonville districts to confirm planned survey areas and identify additional survey requirements. External, non-USACE, stakeholders are encouraged to contact JALBTCX or their local USACE district office to discuss additional survey requirements. Final data products will be available by email request to the local USACE district NCMP point of contact (POC) or JALBTCX (www.jalbtcx.org), and by direct download via NOAA\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Digital Coast (http://www.csc.noaa.gov/digitalcoast/index.html).</supplinf></descript><timeperd><timeinfo><rngdates><begdate>20160101</begdate><begtime>unknown</begtime><enddate>20161201</enddate><endtime>unknown</endtime></rngdates></timeinfo><current>ground extent of bathymetric and topographic lidar data that is planned for this survey effort. Conditions at the time of survey may result in acquired data coverage that varies from the planned data coverage footprint.</complete><posacc><horizpa><horizpar>The data positions from which these polygons were generated was obtained using post-processed KGPS methods. The horizontal accuracy of the data is better than +/- 0.75m.</horizpar><qhorizpa><horizpav>0.75</horizpav><horizpae>1 Sigma</horizpae></qhorizpa></horizpa></posacc><posacc><vertacc><vertaccr>The data positions from which these polygons were generated was obtained using post processed KGPS methods. The vertical accuracy of the data will be better than +/- 0.20m.</vertaccr><qvertpa><vertaccv>0.20</vertaccv><vertacce>1 Sigma</vertacce></qvertpa></vertacc></posacc><lineage><procstep><procdesc>These data were derived via buffer analysis. A lidar-derived shoreline, defined as the NAVD88 0-meter contour was buffered 500 meters landward of the shoreline to depict the onshore extent of planned topographic lidar coverage. The offshore extent of planned bathymetric lidar coverage was derived by applying a 1 kilometer buffer seaward of this same shoreline.</procdesc><procdate>20111101</procdate><proccont><cntinfo><cntorgp><cntorg>JALBTCX</cntorg></cntorgp><cntpos>Data Production Manager</cntpos><cntaddr><addrtype>mailing and physical</addrtype><address>7225 Stennis Airport Rd., STE 100</address><city>Kiln</city><state>MS</state><postal>39556</postal><country>US</country></cntaddr><cntvoice>228-252-1121</cntvoice><cntvoice>228-252-1131</cntvoice><cntfax>228-252-1133</cntfax><cntemail>JALBTCX@usace.army.mil</cntemail><hours>8am -
